well the two common combinations are: enable sound server + use ESD in media selector, or disable sound server + use ALSA in media selector

it sounds like a permission problem. using sudo in front of the cat shouldn't work either, because the > would br redirecting the whole output of "sudo cat /dev/urandom" ...the sudo isn't affecting the write attempt to /dev/dsp
